channel.title: Check to see if Mopar is online!
channel.description:
[center][b][size=15pt]Check For Mopar v.1 by Ron[/size][/b][/center]
You know how Mopar goes down all the time? Well just use this script to see if it's online! It's very easy to use and you can just let it run in the background. When Mopar is online, it will prompt you. :D
First go to whatever mopar website you want to check for. Example... http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf
Then get that TOS cookie if its available. You need to get that cookie because a lot of times this website is not online but the TOS agreement is. So once you got that cookie, just run the script and the script will check every 10 seconds for that website.
Make sure to setup the Const. Enjoy the script. :)

item.title: Check to see if Mopar is online!
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:9, topic:16551”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=24713.msg279799#msg279799 date=1159631440]
I belive

if GetPage(‘http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf’) = ‘’ then
Writeln(‘It’‘s down.’);

works too.
[/quote]
That is not accurate because many times it says “Connection Problems” or some kind of message.

Sometimes there are PHP errors. I check for everything.

wow this is really good, i didnt know you could bring scar up from the tray like that, using getapplications.bringtofront or something

a while ago a was having an intresting discution on mopars forum and just as i was about to say something, BAM, mopars is offline, i wish i had this then

good job Ron, and great idea! ;D

Thanks yakman! :)[/quote]

Works fine for me but good job.

Read full topic

item.title: Check to see if Mopar is online!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

moparisthebest:

Once I stop this DDos attack It should be up all the time

Oooo! DDos attack? Can’t you just limit the TCP connections in registry? But I guess if you could do that, then so could anyone else to prevent it. Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Check to see if Mopar is online!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“Weibs, post:3, topic:16551”]Damn, I made something like that a few days ago when it was on and off throughout the day, but mine didn’t have all the features yours did, but pretty much the same idea. Lol. I like it though, it’ll be useful.

EDIT: I just looked through it and yours is a lot better than mine, lol. I just checked for a few different messages between and . And just wondering, is the line Check_For_TOS; in the main loop supposed to be commented out?

EDIT2: Just tried it, it doesn’t work. Not sure why, I tried changin the check word and URL, but it still says disconnected. Might just be me though.

EDIT3: I think I found the problem, moparisthebest.com has been temporarily moved to moparisthebest.org .[/quote]

Hey thanks Weibs. Yeah it was supposed to be commented out because I couldn’t get it to work lol. I didn’t realize mopar changed domains! Grr lol.

Yeah it would be faster if I set a between instead of searching the entire page. Nice idea.

[quote=“XxKanexX, post:2, topic:16551”]Haha, that’s cool, Ron! Awesome script idea!

<3[/quote]
Thanks Kane.

Read full topic
item.source: Check to see if Mopar is online!

item.title: Check to see if Mopar is online!
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Damn, I made something like that a few days ago when it was on and off throughout the day, but mine didn’t have all the features yours did, but pretty much the same idea. Lol. I like it though, it’ll be useful.

EDIT: I just looked through it and yours is a lot better than mine, lol. I just checked for a few different messages between and . And just wondering, is the line Check_For_TOS; in the main loop supposed to be commented out?

EDIT2: Just tried it, it doesn’t work. Not sure why, I tried changin the check word and URL, but it still says disconnected. Might just be me though.

EDIT3: I think I found the problem, moparisthebest.com has been temporarily moved to moparisthebest.org .

Read full topic
item.source: Check to see if Mopar is online!
